meanings.definition: Make or become stable or more stable.
meanings.sent1: She used extra screws to stabilize the wobbly table.
meanings.sent2: The doctor gave him medicine to help stabilize his blood pressure.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to stabilize the wobbling hat on his head.
meanings.sent4: The new regulations aim to stabilize the economy during uncertain times.
meanings.sent5: The pilot had to quickly stabilize the plane during turbulence.

meanings.sent1: He tried to stabilize his shaky hands before the important presentation.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers used braces to stabilize the tall structure.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to stabilize the wobbling cake before adding the final decorations.
meanings.sent4: The therapist helped her stabilize her emotions during the stressful situation.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk helped stabilize the team's confidence before the big game.
